name: Traditional Folk Music
description: Informed by a long history of tradition in a specific culture or region, mostly associated with the peasantry and non-aristocratic public.

children.name: African Folk Music
children.description: Indigenous music of Africa that is passed down orally from generation to generation, the authors of the songs are usually unknown.

children.name: African Folk Music
children.description: Indigenous music of Africa that is passed down orally from generation to generation, the authors of the songs are usually unknown.

children.name: American Folk Music
children.description: Traces back through the history of European and West African settlement and migration to North America, including parts of northern Mexico and Canada in addition to the United States.

children.name: American Folk Music
children.description: Traces back through the history of European and West African settlement and migration to North America, including parts of northern Mexico and Canada in addition to the United States.

children.name: Arabic Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Arabic people.

children.name: Australian Folk Music
children.description: Folk traditions of the European colonists and convicts in Australia.

children.description: Folk traditions of the European colonists and convicts in Australia.

children.name: Bayawan
children.description: Distinct muqam tradition of the Dolan subgroup of the Uyghur people, often considered the wildest of the regional muqam variations.

children.name: Bayawan
children.description: Distinct muqam tradition of the Dolan subgroup of the Uyghur people, often considered the wildest of the regional muqam variations.

children.name: Brazilian Folk Music
children.description: Comprises the various traditions of folk music found in Brazil, often resulting from the interplay of Indigenous, African and European music.

children.name: Brazilian Folk Music
children.description: Comprises the various traditions of folk music found in Brazil, often resulting from the interplay of Indigenous, African and European music.

children.name: Canadian Folk Music
children.description: Traditional folk of the European settlers who arrived in Canada.

children.name: Caribbean Folk Music
children.description: Meta-genre that covers the different forms of Traditional Folk Music from the Caribbean.

children.name: Caucasian Folk Music
children.description: Folk of the Caucasus region, a mountainous area that connects Eastern Europe to Asia.

children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Chukchi people.

children.name: East Asian Folk Music
children.description: All the forms of Traditional Folk Music from East Asia, including Japanese Folk Music, Chinese Folk Music, and Korean Folk Music.

children.name: European Folk Music
children.description: Encompasses numerous folk traditions found in Europe.

children.name: Football Chant
children.description: Sung by large crowds at association football (soccer) games to celebrate or insult teams.

children.name: Hazara Folk Music
children.description: Folk music of the Hazara people, mainly native to central Afghanistan.

children.name: Hispanic American Folk Music
children.description: Encompasses many varieties of folk traditions from Hispanic America.

children.name: Indigenous American Traditional Music
children.description: Meta-genre encompassing traditions attributed to the indigenous peoples of the Americas.

children.name: Indigenous Australian Traditional Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of Aboriginal Australians and Torres Strait Islanders, collectively known as Indigenous Australians.

children.name: Industrial Folk Song
children.description: Details the experiences and aspirations of industrial laborers and their working conditions; frequently rooted in labor causes and often used for protest and organizational purposes.

children.name: Ladino Folksong
children.description: Ladino-language Traditional Folk Music tunes that were written and preserved by Sephardic Jews.

children.name: Ob-Ugric Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Ob-Ugric people of West Siberia Plain.

children.name: Payada
children.description: Improvised poetry accompanied by a guitar that is tied to gaucho culture, usually performed in duo as a verse duel.

children.description: Improvised poetry accompanied by a guitar that is tied to gaucho culture, usually performed in duo as a verse duel.

children.name: Romani Folk Music
children.description: Folk of the Romani people, an ethnic group with origins in Northern India, but who have since the Middle Ages settled around Europe, principally Romania, Bulgaria, and Spain, and many other places.

children.description: Meta-genre which covers all the Traditional Folk Music forms from South Asia.

children.name: Southeast Asian Folk Music
children.description: Meta-genre covering all folk forms from Southeast Asia, like Gondang, Hmong, Iban, Karen, Keroncong, Khmer, Lao, Lun Bawang, Molam, and Orang Ulu.

children.name: Southeast Asian Folk Music
children.description: Meta-genre covering all folk forms from Southeast Asia, like Gondang, Hmong, Iban, Karen, Keroncong, Khmer, Lao, Lun Bawang, Molam, and Orang Ulu.

children.name: West Asian Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of West Asia, a region that covers much of what is commonly known in English as the Middle East (alternatively Southwestern Asia), includes the distinct but interconnected traditions of numerous ethnic groups.

children.description: Sung by laborers and prisoners while working in factories and fields.

children.name: Yodeling
children.description: Vocal technique that arose in many cultures around the world as a form of calling and communication.
